text:
When me and Gennaro travelled across 
Italy for my new TV series,
we met so many amazing Nonnas.
Their food was incredible!
They were so brilliant and so inspiring
that I just wanted to take them all home with me.
I just love her, I want to take her home.
Come home with me come back to London with me!
And you know what? That's exactly what I did.
Now they all work for me.
So first of all I've got them in my development kitchens
because of course they really know their food.
Then I thought Nonna's give the best welcomes ever,
so I put Nonna Tina on reception.
See the thing is, Nonna's make the simplest things look beautiful,

so now at Jamie Oliver Productions the
Nonna's make all of my TV shows.
Azione!

So today we're gonna make the most
amazing panzanella salad...
and before I knew it the whole place was run by Nonnas.
Well, we've got Nonna cleaners, Nonna security,
Nonna IT
Actually we've got Nonna's all the way up to boardroom level.
You want the wax or you want the olive oil?
You know the answer.
So don't let anyone tell you that Nonna's are behind the times.
My girls -  they're editing, they're doing graphics.
I've got a social media team as well, they love a bit of Snapchat, don't they darling?
I mean these Nonnas they work hard, they play hard
and they drink hard too.
Salute!
Gennaro? He's here he's doing well.
Wonderful! What a time.
Oh my god,  what a joy!
Hello darling!

If there is there something 
better in the world, I don't want to know.

And next week we'll be in the beautiful
city of Rome...
The green button. The green button!
If you press the green button I can hear you.
The green button!
About three o'clock they all need a sleep.
Thanks girls.
It's a bit harder to get a parking space now though.
Click the link to buy the book.
No no no Maria Maria! No no no!
I love my Nonna's.
